xyz.izaak.radon

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.izaak.radon.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    A Game is the fundamental Radon class, representing the entirety of a running game application. All of a Game's functionality should be attached to a Game via implementations of GameSystem which are added to the Game object using the addGameSystem(GameSystem) method. Once all systems have been added, the Game can be executed using run().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String name,
            int width,
            int height,
            org.joml.Vector3f clearColor)
        Constructs a new Game instance
        Parameters:
        name - the title of the Game, which will also be the title of the application window
        width - the initial width of the Game application window
        height - the initial height of the Game application window
        clearColor - the initial argument to glClearColor (the background color of the game world)

    • Method Detail

      • addGameSystem

        public void addGameSystem(GameSystem gameSystem)
        Adds a GameSystem to this Game instance. GameSystems will be initialized and receive callbacks in the order that they are passed to this function.
        Parameters:
        gameSystem - the GameSystem to be added

      • run

        public void run()
        Begin the execution of this Game instance.

      • exitOnGlErrorWithMessage

        public static void exitOnGlErrorWithMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Poll OpenGL for error flags, exiting the application with that exit code should the value be anything other than GL_NO_ERROR
        Parameters:
        message - a message to be printed in addition to the error description

      • exitOnGlErrorWithMessage

        public static void exitOnGlErrorWithMessage(java.lang.String message,
                                            boolean printSuccessOutput)
        Poll OpenGL for error flags, exiting the application with that exit code should the value be anything other than GL_NO_ERROR. Also optionally print on success.
        Parameters:
        message - a message to be printed in addition to the error description
        printSuccessOutput - whether to also print in the case of GL_NO_ERROR
